summary: This is a memorandum documenting a voluntary interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General with a BOP Lieutenant regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The document references attached interview recordings, transcripts, and prison records from August 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation; a BOP inmate who died while housed at MCC New York.

persons.role: Operations Lieutenant at MCC New York
persons.context: A BOP lieutenant interviewed by OIG Senior Special Agent regarding the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death while in custody.

connections.description: The Senior Special Agent conducted a voluntary interview of the Lieutenant as part of the OIG investigation into Epstein's death.
The Lieutenant was an Operations Lieutenant at the MCC New York when Epstein was housed there, placing him in a position of custodial responsibility.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Lieutenant
events.description: Senior Special Agent conducted a voluntary, recorded interview of a BOP Lieutenant regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Prison Counts and Rosters
events.description: Referenced prison documents (Daily Assignment Rosters, Count documentation) from the day before Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
Boston Area Office (DOJ OIG reporting office)
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted an investigation into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
A voluntary, recorded interview was conducted with a BOP Operations Lieutenant who was on duty when Epstein was housed at MCC New York.
The investigation gathered specific prison records from August 9-10, 2019, including daily assignment rosters and inmate count documentation.
The document is an internal OIG memorandum that contains no recommendations or conclusions, and its distribution is restricted.
